messages.title: My Priorities for Croydon South
content: FIGHT OVER-DEVELOPMENT BY THE LABOUR COUNCIL
I will continue to fight to maintain the character of our neighbourhood and keep resisting the Council's awful Purley skyscraper plans.

I have successfully campaigned for a brand new A&E at Croydon Hospital (Mayday) which opened this year, and to extend Purley hospital's opening hours. I will keep fighting for more resources for Croydon's NHS.
MORE POLICE AND BETTER PUBLIC SAFETY

Conservatives will recruit 20,000 extra Police nationally and the Met will be recruiting 1,369 new police officers in 2020/21 alone. I am also campaigning for a new Police base in the Purley/Coulsdon area. Nationally, I am supporting plans to ensure serious criminals spend more of their sentences in jail.

messages.title: IT'S A CONSERVATIVE MAJORITY OR A HUNG PARLIAMENT
content: At the end of this election, we'll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.
The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.
'Jo Swinson says no to second Tory alliance' - The Herald
SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence vote.
Corbyn would have to be propped up by the Scottish Nationalists. And they're demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain.
Don't risk five long years of Corbyn in charge.
